edu.vserver.exercises.videoMcq

Class QuestionLibrary

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.vserver.exercises.videoMcq.QuestionLibrary
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Iterable<Question>

    public class QuestionLibrary
extends Object
implements Iterable<Question>, Serializable
    QuestionLibrary contains all of the questions for the Video stream.

    NOTE: The library holds no duplicates of the questions (see Question.equals(Object)).

    copyright © Ville-Video 2013

    Since:
    1.11.2013
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Sami Holck, Juha Mäkilä
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
    Class invariant:
    FORALL(question : this; !EXIST(q : this; question.equals(q)) && ( question.getNextQuestion() == null || question.getTime() <= question.getNextQuestion().getTime())

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  QuestionLibrary.QuestionNotFoundException
      Thrown to indicate that a Question was not found from the QuestionLibrary.

      • getNextUnanswerded

        public Question getNextUnanswerded(Question question)
        Returns the next unanswered question after the the given in this library.
        Parameters:
        question - question whose unanswered successor in this library is returned.
        Returns:
        the unanswered question at the specified position in this library or null if none was found.
        Postconditions:
        RESULT == null | !RESULT.isAnswered()

      • containsUnanswerded

      • getTimeSlot

        public ArrayList<Question> getTimeSlot(int timeSlot)
        Returns the list of the questions at the given time slot in seconds, or null if none were found.
        Parameters:
        timeSlot - the time of the fetched questions in seconds.
        Returns:
        the list of all the questions at the given time slot, or null.
        Postconditions:
        RESULT == null | RESULT.size() > 0

      • getUnansweredFromTimeSlot

        public ArrayList<Question> getUnansweredFromTimeSlot(int timeSlot)
        Returns the list of all the unanswered questions at the given time in seconds, or null if none were found.
        Parameters:
        timeSlot - index of the question to return.
        Returns:
        the list of all the unanswered questions at the given time slot, or null.
        Postconditions:
        RESULT == null | (RESULT.size() > 0 & FORALL(q : RESULT; q.isAnswered()))

      • containsUnansweredInTimeSlot

        public boolean containsUnansweredInTimeSlot(int timeSlot)
        Indicates whether there are questions in the given time slot and whether that time slot contains any questions that has not yet been answered.
        Parameters:
        timeSlot - the time slot to be checked for a question containing any unanswered questions.
        Returns:
        true if at least one such a question exists; false otherwise.

      • iterator

        public Iterator<Question> iterator()
        Returns an iterator over the Question elements in this library in proper sequence.

        The returned iterator is fail-fast. So it throws a ConcurrentModificationException under either of the following two conditions.

        1. In multithreaded processing: if one thread is trying to modify a Collection while another thread is iterating over it.
        2. In single-threaded or in multithreaded processing: if after the creation of the Iterator, the container is modified at any time by any method other than the Iterator's own remove or add methods.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<Question>
        Returns:
        an iterator over the Question elements in this library in proper sequence.
        See Also:
        Iterable.iterator()
